ing: 1 (12 ounce) container fully cooked luncheon meat (e.g. Spam), cubed
1 small head napa cabbage, cut into small pieces
2 tablespoons soy sauce, or to taste
des: "This recipe comes out of Hawaii and I have been making it for about 20 years now.  It is very good, easy to make and everyone I have made this for loves it.  I serve it on top of a bed of rice."
ins: Heat a skillet over medium heat.  Add the Spam(tm) and cover; fry until browned, about 10 to 15 minutes.   Turn the heat to low; add the cabbage and water.  Cover and steam until the cabbage is crisp tender, about 5 to 7 minutes.  Remove the lid, and stir in the soy sauce and tomato (if using).  Season to taste with salt and pepper.
